//: DEFINITIVE MASTER CONFIGURATION FILE for pySISSO (All Parameters)
1. DATA & I/O SETTINGS
Path to your input data file (CSV format).
The exact column name of the target property you want to predict.
List of columns to ignore (e.g., sample IDs, text labels). They will not be used as features.
Name of the output directory where all results, models, and plots will be saved.
If true, saves the full generated feature space (phi-space) as a compressed CSV.
WARNING: This file can be very large.
If true, the generated feature space is cached in the workdir.
This dramatically speeds up subsequent runs with identical feature generation settings.
2. FEATURE-SPACE CONSTRUCTION
Recursion depth for creating new features. (Legacy key: 'max_rung')
Effect: Higher values create more complex features but exponentially increase computation time.
List of mathematical operators. The modern way is 'op_rules', but legacy 'opset' is supported.
Available ops: add, sub, mul, div, sq, cb, sqrt, cbrt, inv, abs, sign, exp, exp-, log, sin, cos.
You can add constraints, e.g., {"op": "sqrt", "exclude_features": ["Feature_A"]}
[ADVANCED] List of special parametric operators to refine with non-linear optimization.
Currently supported: 'exp-'. An operator listed here must also be in 'op_rules'.
[ADVANCED] If true, only combines different primary features (f1*f2), skipping unary transforms (sqrt(f1)).
Lower bound for the absolute value of any generated feature. Helps prevent underflow or near-zero features.
Upper bound for the absolute value of any generated feature. Helps prevent overflow (e.g., from `exp`).
Optional. Maps feature names to `pint`-compatible unit strings to prevent nonsensical operations.
Requires the 'pint' package to be installed.
3. SEARCH & SELECTION STRATEGY
Maximum dimension (number of features) of the final model. (Legacy key: 'desc_dim')
A list of subspace sizes for Sure Independence Screening (SIS). (Legacy key: 'n_sis_select' or 'top_k')
Running multiple sizes provides robustness. The code will attempt a run for each size in the list.
The core search algorithm.
Choices: 'greedy', 'sisso++', 'omp', 'miqp', 'brute_force'.
Prunes highly correlated features before search to improve stability.
For 'sisso++' only. Factor to shrink the search beam at each dimension (e.g., 0.8).
Value of 1.0 (default) keeps the beam size constant. < 1.0 speeds up search for higher D.
Max iterations for non-linear refinement if 'parametric_ops' are used.
4. MODEL CONSTRUCTION & VALIDATION
The machine learning task. (Legacy key: 'calc_type')
Choices: 'regression', 'multitask', 'classification_svm', 'classification_logreg', 'ch_classification'.
--- Multi-Task-Specific Parameter ---
This parameter is ONLY used if 'task_type' is 'multitask'.
Choices: 'average' (default) or 'cca' (advanced).
For regression: the loss function. 'l2' (Ridge) or 'huber' (robust to outliers).
Regularization strength for Ridge ('l2') or Huber regression.
The 'C' regularization parameter for 'classification_svm'. Inverse of regularization strength.
The 'C' regularization parameter for 'classification_logreg'. Inverse of regularization strength.
Method to select the best dimension D: 'cv' (Cross-Validation) or 'bootstrap' or 'aic' or 'bic'.
Number of folds for K-Fold CV. Use -1 for Leave-One-Out CV (LOOCV).
Number of bootstrap samples if selection_method is 'bootstrap'.
Selects the simplest model whose CV score is within this fractional tolerance of the best score.
A more complex model is only selected if its score improves by at least this absolute value.
Useful for noisy data to prevent overfitting. Default is 0.0.
If true, the linear model will not have an intercept term.
5. COMPUTATIONAL SETTINGS
Number of CPU cores for parallel tasks. -1 uses all. (Legacy key: 'num_cpu_threads')
Hardware for acceleration ('cpu', 'cuda', 'mps'). Affects only some parts of the code.
Specifies which GPU to use if device is 'cuda' and you have multiple GPUs.
Controls numerical precision. 'float64' (default, safer) or 'float32' (faster, less memory).
A legacy boolean 'use_single_precision': true is equivalent to 'dtype': 'float32'.
Seed for the random number generator to ensure run-to-run reproducibility.
